docs.snippet: If he wins the presidency, Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump would seek to purge the federal government of officials appointed by Democratic President Barack Obama and could ask Congress to pass legislation making it easier to fire publ...
docs.lead_paragraph: If he wins the presidency, Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump would seek to purge the federal government of officials appointed by Democratic President Barack Obama and could ask Congress to pass legislation making it easier to fire public workers, Trump ally, Chris Christie, said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Exclusive: Trump Could Seek New Law to Purge Government of Obama Appointees
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Trump Could Seek New Law to Purge Government of Obama Appointees

docs.snippet: Merrick Garland hit an unwanted milestone on Tuesday as the federal appeals court judge's nomination to the U.S. Supreme Court reached its 125th day with no Senate action, tying for the longest pending nomination ever to the high court....
docs.lead_paragraph: Merrick Garland hit an unwanted milestone on Tuesday as the federal appeals court judge's nomination to the U.S. Supreme Court reached its 125th day with no Senate action, tying for the longest pending nomination ever to the high court.

headline.main: Supreme Court Nominee Out in Cold as Election Heats Up
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Nominee Out in Cold as Election Heats Up

docs.snippet: American political conventions once had real drama as parties held rounds and rounds of voting before settling on a presidential nominee.  Now, they are highly staged television pep rallies as party loyalists anoint a nominee determined in state p...
docs.lead_paragraph: American political conventions once had real drama as parties held rounds and rounds of voting before settling on a presidential nominee.  Now, they are highly staged television pep rallies as party loyalists anoint a nominee determined in state primaries and caucuses.

headline.main: AP EXPLAINS: Do US Political Conventions Still Matter?
headline.print_headline: AP EXPLAINS: Do US Political Conventions Still Matter?

docs.snippet: United States Vice President Joe Biden on Wednesday assured key ally Australia there would be no retreat from Washington's pivot to the Asia-Pacific region regardless of who wins November's presidential election....
docs.lead_paragraph: United States Vice President Joe Biden on Wednesday assured key ally Australia there would be no retreat from Washington's pivot to the Asia-Pacific region regardless of who wins November's presidential election.

headline.main: No Retreat From Asia Pivot Regardless of Who Wins U.S. Presidency: Biden
headline.print_headline: No Retreat From Asia Pivot Regardless of Who Wins U.S. Presidency: Biden

docs.snippet: Donald Trump, having clinched the Republican Party's nomination for the Nov. 8 presidential election, threatens U.S. and world security with his "politics of fear and isolation," German Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump, having clinched the Republican Party's nomination for the Nov. 8 presidential election, threatens U.S. and world security with his "politics of fear and isolation," German Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Trump's 'Politics of Fear' Dangerous for U.S., World: German Foreign Minister
headline.print_headline: Trump's 'Politics of Fear' Dangerous for U.S., World: German Foreign Minister

docs.snippet: As her fellow Republicans gathered in Cleveland, New Hampshire Sen. Kelly Ayotte was back home touting her work on a bipartisan bill intended to address opioid abuse....
docs.lead_paragraph: As her fellow Republicans gathered in Cleveland, New Hampshire Sen. Kelly Ayotte was back home touting her work on a bipartisan bill intended to address opioid abuse.

headline.main: Looking at Own Prospects, Some Republicans Avoid Cleveland
headline.print_headline: Looking at Own Prospects, Some Republicans Avoid Cleveland
